Topic.Title: Hey! what's the matter with T today?

Message.Msg: It sure isn't Option Expiration today. Maybe we are on the way to the $35.5 pull back that technical analysis has been calling for. Oh, I forgot, TA is BS.
For a Monday, how is your moral stranger?

The sequester didn't affect your taxes. Nor did it affect your Soc. Sec. check, nor your precious Medicare. You're quite insulated from all of this. Your checks will keep flowing, your taxes are unchanged, and debt that you will not contribute to paying down will continue to accrue because sequester does not affect the largest parts of the budget. Who is affected? Working people. Military personnel. Young people. Revel in this all you want, but you're stealing from your children.
'How about the moral of federal income tax payers' The morals of federal taxpayers goes down as income rises. That's why the tax code is like it is.
Thank you !
BS. ... and for the record, the original poster probably meant morale.
Awesome report , thanks !
I rather think that the tax code is"like it is" because it was put together by 97 committees.

I would gladly give up my SS and Medicare if those programs and deductions were discontinued and written into the Constitution that they, or any similar program, could never be re-instituted. In my lifetime they have grown from 0 to 15% of income. I can only imagine what they will be for my 8 great grandchildren.

Topic.Title: Ryan with his BA and minor in Econ

Message.Msg: Ryan double majored in economics and political science.

Or, and call me crazy, we could make reasonable changes to the programs to make them solvent and less generationally redistributive. In another thread I asked you about some potential reasonable changes, a question you chose to ignore. Probably because you are not really interested in ANY changes. You Tea Brains continually put up insurmountable roadblocks to any minor or reasonable change. You can't adjust Medicare--we have to pass a Constitutional amendment abolishing it forever and ever first! You can't adjust gun laws--that's just a slippery slope (which is an insurmountable argument). There can't be any change to fiscal policy if it involves one cent of new revenue! These arguments are designed explicitly to maintain the status quo by being insurmountable. They maintain high deficit spending on the elderly while giving the appearance of wanting change.

Topic.Title: Ryan with his BA and minor in Econ

Message.Msg: I doubt that was the reason for the "C." No "teacher" does what you suggest. In college we have "professors." I find it interesting the right can be so gullible and dishonest about ryan, yet accuse the Pres for not having gone to school, appearing as if he arrived out of thin air, any credential is "photoshopped." Ryan, romney, bush, etc get a pass on their record, no questions asked, why? When I hire a roofer I want experience and credentials, when my child goes to school, I want a credentialed, preferably well treated, unionized career teacher.

Not to mention the fact that you previously accepted the notion of a 6% cut in Medicare/Soc. Sec. You only balked when the details of the cut became tricky. The solutions might affect you, or they might require some trade-offs and compromises, suddenly we can't make the 6% cut? We need a Constitutional Amendment banning the practice entirely? Ridiculous.
Very helpful report , thanks .
Very helpful report , thanks .

I still find it troublesome to believe your point of view about old folks. Somewhere along the long one or more of those old folks raised you, provided for you, fed and housed you, maybe even provided for some of your education...yet you are more like the Democratic publicity guys and want them all to die alone and sick like a conservative. I see your predicament though, all you liberals that support gay marriage, abortion, etc. are having a negative impact on the population growth, at least of citizens, and that means there are becoming fewer of you to support us geezers. Maybe you should reconsider your positions. We geezers are dying off at a pretty brisk pace, but apparently not hastily enough for you. In the meantime Obama wants to spend as much of your money as ours on many, too many stupid things while you support him. And you wonder why people question your wisdom.
OK, we don't need a Constitutional Amendment. We just need honest judges on the Supreme Court who adhere to the Constitution.
Again, stonewalling. Say you want deficit reduction and change all you want. We know what you are.

fallenangelsthree, Not only did we pay into Social Security our whole lives, but now we get to pay tax on 85% of what we draw each year. To those low information types on this board (Spinning Ricky) please refer to lines 20a and 20b on your Federal Tax Form 1040. Social Security is not like Welfare, Earned Income Credit, Medicade, etc., etc., etc. ad infinitum.

Just like lavendar shouldn't confuse himself with white people, you shouldn't confuse yourself with old folks, winholder. You Tea Brains are an extreme minority. You may be miserly, fearful, dishonest, partisan and willingly ignorant. Many, and I hope most, are not. It is *your* efforts to protect your narrow self-interest at the cost of younger generations and the future of America that I dislike. "too many stupid things" Which are all the things you've had the benefit of all of your life but don't need anymore, right? Education, student loans, infrastructure, UI. Nope, just keep those government checks flowing! "you liberals that support gay marriage, abortion, etc. are having a negative impact on the population growth" Partisan and willfully ignorant.
Did I mention curmudgeonly?

People draw on Social Security regardless of income so I am not sure why you think it should be exempt from taxes? Maybe the theory is if it is income Romney gets, it shouldn't be taxed. . . Social Security and Medicare are entitlements, but they mostly benefit the wealthiest people for a variety of reasons: 1. Payroll taxes are not withheld on income over $110,000. 2. Soc. Sec. benefits are higher for those with higher lifetime earnings. 3. Wealthy people tend to live longer, meaning they tend to collect benefits longer.
You shouldn't be ashamed to collect them. You should be ashamed they weren't paid for, and that they are paid by debt your children and grandchildren will have to pay off.

Message.Title: Garbage in but no garbage out !
Message.Msg: This MB seldom has anything to do with T, but has a lot of political/racial rants. I'm not interested in your subjective thoughts, which effectively undermines any credibility for this MB.

You have no understanding of the aims of the Tea Party. Your statement " It is *your* efforts to protect your narrow self-interest at the cost of younger generations and the future of America that I dislike" clearly indicates that you think America is better now than it was in 1930. I was alive then and I assure you it was better then. People did not rely on the government for help; they relied on each other. There was no minimum wage and workers kept their entire paycheck. The Tea Party are like the emigrants that came to America back then. Just people "longing to be free".

Message.Title: Over $21 Million in 2012 for the CEO,
Message.Msg: even after his $4 Billion give-away to T-Mobile. If Stephenson gets that kind of pay, should see some good union contracts this time!

VZ has nearly 4 times the revenue that T has and enjoys a gross profit margin of 60% compared to T at only 47%. VZ sales are increasing faster than T. In the past year VZ 200 day SMA has increased 21% while T has only increased 16%. The nearly 3 billion one time write off in 2011 gave T a high trailing P/E Ratio although not as high as VZ has. Basically the answer is because VZ is a better run company.
